title: Besu randomly crashes and stops syncing

labels.name: P2
labels.description: High (ex: Degrading performance issues, unexpected behavior of core features (DevP2P, syncing, etc))

labels.name: TeamChupa
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Chupacabara Team

body:
**Expected behavior:** It works

**Actual behavior:** It doesn't work

**Frequency:** About 1-2 hours after restarting Besu

### Logs (if a bug)

This happens on a new machine, new Rocket Pool install, new sync. It was fully synced and working but throws this error after a couple of hours (around 2-3) and stays there. Restarting it makes it work again until the same error pops up (again, after a couple of hours). This is a default Rocket Pool install. Another note: syncing took about 2.5-3 days rather than the ~6 hours I've read everywhere. Not sure if this is relevant.

Another note: I probably won't be able to do a lot of testing. I've lost quite some time with this already so I'll be moving to another client to get things up and running as soon as possible. I'll try to keep the Besu files if my storage allows it.

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: `besu/v23.4.1/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-17`
* Java version: `openjdk version "17.0.7" 2023-04-18`
* OS Name & Version: `Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS"`
* Kernel Version: `5.14.0-284.11.1.el9_2.x86_64`
* Docker Version: `Docker version 24.0.2, build cb74dfc`
* Consensus Client & Version if using Proof of Stake: `Teku 23.5.0`

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
* Besu setup info - genesis file, config options
Standard Rocket Pool install, environment variables as found in the compose file
```
      BESU_JVM_HEAP_SIZE: "0"
      BESU_MAX_BACK_LAYERS: "512"

      RP_NETHERMIND_ADDITIONAL_URLS: ""

```
* System info - memory, CPU
Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E3-1270 V2 3.5GHz 8-core
29GB RAM
Do you see besu restart in the logs? Maybe besu is killed
I see in your ticket that it is after a restart. How do you  stop besu? It seems that Besu was not stopped correctly

Itâ€™s not OOM, it has enough ram. If after switching to another client you also get errors, it might be a hardware fault. Unusual with xeons but not unheard of. You can check the ipmi on that box for any ECC errors, since I assume this is ECC ram. And check the ssd with smartctl -x 

Good luck!

I've got something similar, possibly. It's been putting out logs like this every minute for > hour, with different block hashes. Prior to this, the execution client stopped at a similar error and was restarted. This is rocketpool, so the whole thing was stopped and started (rocketpool service stop/start).
